page.title: 18RELIGIOUS ESTABLISHMENTS
page.content: There are{three churches and a small {mission. Two years ago the churches were{amalgated and are now referred to as the{Howe of Fife.}They are in the care of a{Minister and assistant. The {church in Ladybank is 109 years old {and was originally the United Free {Church. The church in Kingskettle was {built in the 19th}century.The services are from 10.45 to 11.45 in Ladybank and 11.55 to 12.55 in Kingskettle.{St. {Mary's Episcopal Church is the {smallest church in Fife. They have {services every 2nd. & 4th Sunday at {9.15. They Ladybank Gospel Hall or the Mission was built{around 1910 by the {railway for the railwaymen.}On a Sunday about 16 people come in the morning & 30 at night.{For the young {they provide girls and boys clubs, {walks, swimming, trips, weekends and {camps.
